title: New Plymouth
summary: New Plymouth (Māori: Ngāmotu) is the major city of the Taranaki region on the west coast of the North Island of New Zealand. It is named after the English city of Plymouth, Devon from where the first English settlers to New Plymouth migrated. The New Plymouth District, which includes New Plymouth City and several smaller towns, is the 10th largest district (out of 67) in New Zealand, and  has a population of 87,300 – about two-thirds of the total population of the Taranaki Region and  1.7% of New Zealand's population. This includes New Plymouth City (58,400), Waitara (7,290), Inglewood (3,790), Ōakura (1,690), Ōkato (561) and Urenui (429).[2]
